cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Port Aransas, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northward just off the south-central Texas coast, then forecast to turn north-northeast and track inland across east-central Texas and into southwest Louisiana during Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX to Rutherford Beach LA (includes Calcasieu and Sabine Lakes)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Louisiana – Tropical-storm warnings stop at Sabine Pass TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper and middle Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast (including Lake Charles area)
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (≤14%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 25-40 mph possible Tuesday-Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Calcasieu and Sabine Lakes if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain possible; localized flash and urban flooding likely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and brief power outages
